user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_response_entry_no_alloc_:
```c
bool
MHD_add_response_entry_no_alloc_ (struct MHD_Response *response,
                                  enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                                  char *header,
                                  size_t header_len,
                                  char *content,
                                  size_t content_len)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr;

  mhd_assert (0 != header_len);
  mhd_assert (0 != content_len);
  if (NULL == (hdr = MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header))))
    return false;

  hdr->header = header;
  hdr->header_size = header_len;
  hdr->value = content;
  hdr->value_size = content_len;
  hdr->kind = kind;
  _MHD_insert_header_last (response, hdr);

  return true; /* Success exit point */
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I examined all function parameters: response, kind, header, header_len, content, content_len. The code does not modify any of these parameter variables. It only copies their values into the newly allocated hdr fields (hdr->header = header; hdr->value = content; hdr->header_size = header_len; hdr->value_size = content_len; hdr->kind = kind) and passes response to _MHD_insert_header_last. There are no assignments to the parameter identifiers themselves (e.g., no "header = ...", "content = ...", or "response = ..."), nor any pointer arithmetic that would change the pointer parameters. Dereferencing of the pointer parameters to modify their pointees also does not occur. Therefore there are no fragments that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 in this function.
